headline: Several Democrats now regret forcing Al Franken to resign
subHeadline: Sen. Al Franken resigned in 2017 over sexual misconduct allegations after widespread pressure from within the Democratic Party; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Dagen McDowell, Juan Williams, Katie Pavlich, and Gregory. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, and this is “The Five.” The Democrats are desperately pinning their Trump impeachment hopes on former special counsel Robert Mueller's testimony tomorrow. While they're obsessively clinging to the collusion narrative that's already been debunked, President Trump shrugging off the left's Mueller mania. Instead, he's focusing on what really matters, the battle for 2020. With Democrats distracted, the president is using the moment to relentlessly hammer his opponents as far-left socialists.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: Even the Democrats they laugh, but now they're getting dragged into a radical left position. We're gonna do the green new deal, which is the craziest thing I've ever heard.  When I'm up there in the debate all along with some maniac that they chose, and that maniac is saying, we're going to do this for you, we're going to do that for you, we'll gonna give you everything. We're gonna give you -- everybody gets a free Rolls Royce, every family. And we're gonna take better care of illegal immigrants than we take care of our own citizens.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. The Rolls Royce line he loves. It's the second time I heard that this week, Katie. So, tomorrow is gonna be a good day. Obviously, it's going to be wall-to-wall, but, you know, who knows how many days it's gonna last afterwards, and we're going to be right back to the presidential election.

utterances.speaker: KATIE PAVLICH, HOST
utterances.sentences: I've always said that during Nadler and Adam Schiff's continuation of the Mueller investigation after it ended, even though they said his -- and the report was going to end-all, be-all, is really just an opposition research campaign for the 2020 Democrats, who, like, Kamala Harris have called for the president to be impeached over the, quote, findings, in the Mueller report even though there was no collusion, no obstruction.  So tomorrow, Robert Mueller will be saying a lot of things, maybe not saying so many things. The DOJ said today that he's the one who ask for the letter to confine what he's supposed to be saying, which is what's already in the report. We're also hearing he's going to submit his report for the record. But when it comes to 2020 and President Trump, he's winning on issues that really matter.   There's a new merit poll out today showing that his approval rating is as high as it's been. The number of people who are voting against him has gone down. The number of people who are voting for him has gone up. And all of the issue that Democrats are talking about on the campaign trail, health care for illegal aliens, Medicare for all, support for that among independent voters especially has gone way down. So he's winning on that. And tomorrow is just gonna be a show that we've seen before.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And Trump sums up seven point, Juan, with independents, which is pretty interesting considering all the heat he gets in the mainstream media. Another poll that I found interesting, the American public care about health care and taxes, almost quintuple the amount they care about Mueller and Russian --

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: Quintuple.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Quintuple. That's five times for those watching at home.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's amazing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Do you think the Democrats risk anything by, again, focusing on Russia, and the American people are focus on kitchen table issues?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.sentences: No, gosh. They're focused on health care what does Trump have? What the Republicans have if they're focus on –

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They have the greatest health care plan ever. They're working on those details right as we speak.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh. And spending? Gee, I think it's Republicans who have problems with this deficit, heavy deal that the president sign on to. That kind of spending used to be -- to Republicans, but now Republicans are just Trumpians and they say, oh, we don't see anything, nothing here, nothing to worry about. What if we're big spenders? No problem. We used to say about the liberals and the left, but when we do it, fine. Look, you guys are all saying, it's Democrats who are obsessing. The one who is obsessing is President Trump, this is a witch hunt he tweets. He keeps saying, oh, this is ridiculous. Ridiculous. Oh, yeah, he says this is a second bite at the apple. What a waste of time. Don't do it.  You know, this is, to me, I just don't understand. You guys, and I just heard it from Katie, no collusion, no obstruction. Well, if that's the case, you guys should be saying, please, Robert Mueller, get out there and talk.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: A lot of Republicans are excited to ask Mueller questions on their own.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And to contrary, what you hear from members of the judiciary committee who are Republicans is, you know, we don't know why we're doing this. This is going to be a big nothing. President Trump says I'm not even going to watch. I'm not gonna watch.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is Greg going to watch tomorrow?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hell, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I've got a life. This isn't the second bite, this is the 14th bite. You know what the Democrats -- you guys are like? What you guys are like? You're like civil war reenactors for the losing side. You'd dress up every day to play the losing side hoping for a different outcome. You're holding mock hearings as though this is a high school rendition of Fiddler on the Roof. It is so pathetic and laughable. Look, the Democrats face the same problem that their parent company, CNN, does. In times of prosperity, how do you gin up conflict? And they only have two clubs in their golf bag, that's Russia and that Trump is a giant orange monster. So I have a prediction for 2020 because of all of this media fakery. They're gonna create a repeat surprise in 2020 based on preference deception. If you take the politically correct climate and now you add this constant race smear and this collusion thing, they're going to create an illusion of uniformity.   Because if everyone you know said Trump is evil, then no one is actually going to say the truth because they don't want to be -- they don't want to confront you while you're having these confrontational, you know, tantrums. So this is why Brexit surprised Europe, and why Trump surprise the world in 2016. As they keep ginning up this hysteria half the people are going to move to the other side just like they did before.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah. You keep calling him a racist every single day it's going to turn a lot of people off. Dagen, I want to show you something from Cory Booker who was on one of the late shows the other night and had this to say about the president. Watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump is a guy who -- you understand it, he hurts you. In my testosterone, sometimes, makes me want -- feel like punching him, which would be bad for this elderly, out of shape man that he is if I did that. Physically weak specimen.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Physically weak specimen, that some really good trash talk right there.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, HOST
utterances.sentences: Any woman knows that if a man has to talk about his testosterone, you got nothing. This is the end of your road to nowhere, and the same for the Democrats conducting this Mueller hearing. My favorite line from the Wall Street Journal editorial a while ago was charge Donald Trump with obstructing, and investigation that wasn't obstructed into a conspiracy that didn't exist.  Again, you've got nada, knit day, zero, zip, zilch. My favorite quote from Albert Brooks from broadcast news as his character, wouldn't this be a great world if insecurity and desperation made us more attractive? If needy were a turn on, guess what? It's still not a turn on. And that's why --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- will lose.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What Cory did, though, is -- I think he's violence signaling. You heard about virtue signaling? You saw the start with Kathy Griffin and the head, and then it move to Madonna saying she wants to bomb the White House. Johnny Depp making the assassination joke. What happens is they're actually violent signaling to the hard left that they actually agree. He's part of the Antifa. You know, he's saying, you know, I'd really like to punch him, but it is kind of sad to see him act this way because it is a sign of insecurity as he's fading away. And he just keep talking in this word vomit. It's like, where is he going?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So I've got to say, Trump often talks in terms of violent rhetoric, and I'll pay your bills, punch them out. Oh, my gosh --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'll pay your bills?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Trump didn't -- I don't think Cory Booker called his opponents horse --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, no. The difference is, Juan --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's not violent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They need someone macho enough to take on Donald Trump. And then they always say, but we're gonna fall into that trap. We're not going to get into the gutter. But what do they do? I'm gonna punch him out. I'm gonna challenge him to a push-up contest. I'm gonna throw him in prison. They're right in the gutter where he wants them.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: He's actually trying to out-macho Joe Biden. How pathetic is that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: and you know who beats both of them? Marianne Williamson, who is actually smart and coming at a different direction with love. She's like, I don't need to play this game. That's why she's so much smarter than those guys.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And she doesn't have any toxic masculinity, which is clearly driving all of these Democrats to engage in violent rhetoric --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is this a rally? Is this a Trump rally for Marianne Williamson? I wonder why?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why do you not like Marianne Williamson? She's your smartest candidate?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that's saying a lot. Coming up, outrage growing over viral video showing police officers being attacked, is the left anti-cop rhetoric to blame? But first, President Trump says he's making straws great again. Greg's monologue is going to explain that next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: While most political campaign sell tacky t-shirts that nobody wants. What does Trump campaign selling? An attitude in the form of recyclable plastic straws. Since the campaign tweeted, making straws great again, the first batch of 140,000 sold out, that's 200 grand in sales. Now, you can call this silly or mean, but it's really pretty hilarious. The Trump straw targets key liberal weaknesses. They're strident humorlessness and misplaced priorities, and pokes them right in the eyes.  The crusade to ban plastic straws is yet more proof of how liberals try to distract us from the harm they've done to our cities, our law enforcement, our job markets, and our border. Maybe no one will notice what they did to the humans of downtown L.A. and other Democratic hellholes if they save a turtle from a straw. Yep, an actual headline said, someday, a turtle may end up with a Trump-branded straw in its nose. Wow. Who knew reptiles did coke. So Trump saw this absurd crusade as a perfect opportunity for the new Republican Party, one that finally understands the power of fun and the muscle of mockery. Long the turf solely owned by the smirking left. The script's been flip. It's now the left the left who shriek like nosy neighbors and the right who are laughing out loud.  The paper straw is a perfect symbol. A failed soggy replacement for something that work just fine. A paper straw is socialism to capitalism's sturdy plastic. How funny is it that the straw's purpose it to suck. So you think the left would do that well. Wrong. They even suck at sucking. I have to say that Trump might be the first president -- well, is the first president in history to galvanize trolling for fun and profit.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So the campaign manager for Trump 2020, Brad Parscale tweeted last week that he's so over paper straws, hashtag liberal progress. This is exactly what they would do to you -- the economy as well, squeeze it until it doesn't work. And then they started selling real straws to raise tons of money, which -- this is the reaction, right? Like when you go so far to the left and you tell people they can't do something, they're going to continue doing it in the most troll worthy way possible and to make campaign donation to buy real straws. I would do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What other things, Juan, should they sell? Lawn darts?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I want everyone to listen because I'm going to give President Trump some credit. I think he is just genius of getting people to separate themselves from their money. So it's not fear we're going to take your guns, now we're going to take your straws, and you can mock the liberals -- oh, yeah, that's great. Mocking people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's fun.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's now -- it's not like, you know, it's silly and ridiculous. It's fun, so go right ahead. To me, you know, I just think the Bible says, you know, we should be good stewards of the earth. And now, oh, no, don't pay attention to that, just go ahead, do whatever you want.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What was the Bible printed on?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, paper --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Trees. Those poor trees, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg, I'm going to have to agree with Juan on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And here's why. I get that he's tap into this guy and say this is a brilliant marketing plan to raise a lot of money for the campaign --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's fine. I'm not like on a plastic straws jihad. But, we will eventually phase out plastic straws and here's why.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They're the top -- in the top ten most polluted items on the world's beaches. And they clog up the streams and the waterways and the lakes and the rivers and the oceans because they're so thin they don't get collected up. So, when I'm on a beach I don't want to see a straw, I want to body surf without straws. I want to tan without straws. I know you do, too. When I fish because the fish eats the straws and then they die, I want to eat the fish before they die. I want to kill the fish, I don't want the straws to kill it. I think we can all agree on this that paper straws are better for the environment, and they don't disintegrate. I mean, how long do you take to sip an ice coffee, an hour? You sip it, it's over.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: This last like two seconds.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: They don't work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, they don't work.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Hold on a second.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: By the way, they try to give you metal straws --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- is what they chip your damn teeth.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It works fine.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: So unless Medicare in there --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- unless Medicare for all --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Unless Medicare for all is going to pay for my venire --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let me throw to the president talking about this, then, we'll get a response from you, OK? Let's do that.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I do think we have bigger problems in plastic straws. You know, it's interesting about plastic straws. So you have a little straw, but what about the plates, the wrappers and everything else that are much bigger and they're made of the same material? So, the straws are interesting. Everybody focuses on the straws. There's a lot of other things to focus, but it's an interesting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Dagen, the Washington Post wrote a piece, you know, saying like, you know, this is going to harm turtles. They're paper. The newspaper often comes in a plastic container. You know, it's hypocrisy all around.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: It is hypocrisy. I love the liberal lunacy and say San Francisco that bans plastic straws but the city is covered in human excrements, that's not just the stench of sanctimonious if you smell -- when you're walking around San Fran. And just one other thing, at the beaches you know what's a bigger problem than plastic straws? I don't know. Cigarette butts, candy wrappers, beer cans, condoms.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. So get rid of those --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're turning into a liberal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We can do it here, too.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: We're doing it here,

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And look, this straw is fully intact.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan and I are on the same side.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I agree with you because I'm going on vacation. I don't want all that junk on the beach.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So this is all selfish.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We can sell everything. He says what about the plastic --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I love plastic. I love plastic.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I do, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Someday I'm going to have a lot of it in my face, so I love it even more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When you see liberal celebrities arguing against plastic as they shoot Botox into their face.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And other places.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I'm really worried about poisoning people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. All right, some Democrats now regret their takedown of former Senator Al Franken, we'll talk about that, next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Democrats are having serious regrets about forcing former Senator Al Franken of Minnesota out of office. Franken resigned back in 2017 over sexual misconduct allegations after widespread pressure from within his own party. But now, a New Yorker article reveals several Democratic senators wished he never stepped aside. And Franken said he, quote, absolutely regret, end quote, his decision, while adding -- and here I'm quoting again, the idea that anybody who accuses someone of something is always right, that's not the case. That isn't reality, end quote. Now, while some Democrats say they made a mistake, one of Franken's biggest critics, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand, is doubling down,

utterances.speaker: SEN. KIRSTEN GILLIBRAND, D-N.Y.
utterances.sentences: Senator Franken wasn't denying anything. It's his decision and his alone, whether to wait out his ethics committee hearing, whether to wait for his next election. The decision I made is whether or not to carry his water and stay silent. And to somehow blame me for a man's actions and a man decision is pretty absurd.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Jesse, do you think Franken should have resigned? He didn't have anything in the court of law, no due process, so I'm thinking, sometimes, you know, these cases can be subjective because time change, perspective changes, so I get people who said, yeah, he should get out saying now I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, he was pretty low on the Me-Too totem pole. I think everybody agrees with that. But this was in the context of the Democrats wanting to look pure while they're trying to attack Roy Moore. And it was fresh off the heels of the Weinstein situation, so they were going to get killed with what-about-ism if they have stuck behind Al Franken.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: At this table?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, just in the media -- in the media. But I think the real deal is the Jane Mayer who did this piece is not a real journalist. She's an advocate for Democrats. This was a puff piece to rehab his images and his career, and she didn't treat anybody the same way as she would have treated Al Franken. Why doesn't she look at some of the sexual harassment lawsuit settlements in Congress the taxpayers have to play for? No.  She was a headache for the Bush administration, slimed CIA agents let Obama off the hook, and now she's back helping Trump -- helping people who hate Trump. This is what happens here with Democrats. They only care about due process for Democrats. Whenever there's an accusation against a Republican it's conviction. She says she pokes holes in the accuser's story? She -- what hole? The accuser said the photo with this was taken December 24th. She says oh, no, it was taken December 21st.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Whoa.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Whoa, big hole. I mean, I think they're much more holes poked in the Kavanaugh accuser's story than that. But ultimately, the Me-Too movement still strong. I think maybe it's swinging a little back and it's not as hysterical as it used to be. But men now, I think, are behaving better and women are reporting things immediately. But I still think -- bring back the slap rule. Once a man gets fresh, slap them right in the face. That will sting a lot.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. So -- but, Katie, you know, I'm thinking to myself about standards now. Jesse rightly mentioned that Jane Meyer had written a piece about the Kavanaugh hearings. And so I'm thinking to myself, what is the standard for elected officials with regards to inappropriate sexual behavior? Because it looks to me like, you know, when the charges are against the Democrat you don't get away, but when it's against Kavanaugh, yes, get away. Where's the due process?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well, first of all, we should mention that the Kavanaugh case -- the senate judiciary committee came out with a 400-page report after all the committee hearings were over and he was confirmed showing that not a single accusation against him panned out and didn't have any kind of evidence. So you asked what the standard is, the standard is evidence, not jumping to conclusions, not necessarily believing women, but taking them seriously making sure you weigh both sides of the story.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But there's no such thing --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- especially as a writer who's claiming to be a journalist --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right. But I'm saying to you that there's no such evidence presented in the Franken case.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: There were photos that were presented. There was, you know, information --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: She was asleep. She was asleep. And, oh, it's a joke.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: There's no information or evidence presented at all outside of accusations from 30 years ago. In fact, there's lot of evidence to show that they're connected, the accusers, to Democrats who was trying to take down Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh. So the standard is, everybody take a breath, if we want women to actually be taken seriously, you cannot continue to push forward false allegations or jump to conclusion because it actually hurts people who have real cases against men who are abusers or who are sexual predators.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So you think he should have resigned?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I mean, I don't know what he should have done. He definitely didn't get the due process that he should have. And for Kirsten Gillibrand to sit there and say that, you know, I have nothing to deal with this, she was one of the first people to call --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: She was the first senator -

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: She was leading the charge on it. So she certainly had something to do with the pressure on him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, Dagen, Trump's been accused many times. He denies in every case. So all you have to do is deny and then the women aren't heard and, you know, is that all you want? Really, is that fair?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I think that the women have been heard in plenty of forums, quite frankly, Juan. And I will say this about Al Franken, what's the point of this article in the New Yorker for him? He's the victim. When you talked about that photo of Leanne Tweeden, she was asleep, and he got away with it, in part, and they're making excuses for it now because, oh, he's a comedian. There were seven other accusers which are mentioned in the article. And what is the point of this article in the New Yorker to send the message to Democrats and liberal men of like, next time, we'll go easy on you. But to the Republicans, they will bake fry and microwave you until there is nothing left.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think he's President still.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Say it again, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think President Trump is still there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, he is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. So, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I was thinking about this and I thought to myself well what sanctions are in place like you know you get someone like that guy Steve King with all of his white nationalist rhetoric, Republicans have sanctioned and stripped them. But they don't make him resign. The Democrats made Franken get out.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: They didn't make him do anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: His party ate him alive. It's the shoot first ask questions later world of the Me-Too movement. He was right there. However, he's not innocent. I mean I know personally two people he did this to. OK. We talked about it, not just Leeanne. We know that Kathie Lee - if Frank Gifford were alive today, he would beat the crap out of Al Franken. So, I think everybody knew this about Al Franken that he used to grab people, kiss but he bragged about it on Howard Stern or he talked about it in the green room, which was then brought up on Howard Stern. And there is visual evidence that Jane Mayer ignored. She used gossip to destroy Kavanaugh. But no, there is actually stories about Al Franken. I wish he had due process. I wish he stuck around. I wish he had actually been questioned. We could have seen with this go. But I think like a lot of people he had the progressive pig pass, which is like Bill Clinton, Harvey Weinstein, Epstein, they survive and thrive as long as you support Democrats. They look the other way.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, you're saying you thought he should have had due process before leaving.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. But I think that there was - he was guilty, but he should have gone through. He should have stuck around, but maybe he knew - maybe he knew it was going to get ugly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, you can't say that Greg isn't fair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Up next, shocking video shows New York City cops getting drenched with water and hit with buckets. Upsetting. Next on “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: The left's anti-cop rhetoric is being blamed for outrageous video showing New York City police officers being attacked. The cops were hit with objects and drenched with water and too wild scenes. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh! My God, they came over here to talk, they violated. They're not stopping.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, no. The difference is, Juan --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's not violent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They need someone macho enough to take on Donald Trump. And then they always say, but we're gonna fall into that trap. We're not going to get into the gutter. But what do they do? I'm gonna punch him out. I'm gonna challenge him to a push-up contest. I'm gonna throw him in prison. They're right in the gutter where he wants them.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: He's actually trying to out-macho Joe Biden. How pathetic is that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: and you know who beats both of them? Marianne Williamson, who is actually smart and coming at a different direction with love. She's like, I don't need to play this game. That's why she's so much smarter than those guys.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: And she doesn't have any toxic masculinity, which is clearly driving all of these Democrats to engage in violent rhetoric --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is this a rally? Is this a Trump rally for Marianne Williamson? I wonder why?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why do you not like Marianne Williamson? She's your smartest candidate?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And that's saying a lot. Coming up, outrage growing over viral video showing police officers being attacked, is the left anti-cop rhetoric to blame? But first, President Trump says he's making straws great again. Greg's monologue is going to explain that next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: While most political campaign sell tacky t-shirts that nobody wants. What does Trump campaign selling? An attitude in the form of recyclable plastic straws. Since the campaign tweeted, making straws great again, the first batch of 140,000 sold out, that's 200 grand in sales. Now, you can call this silly or mean, but it's really pretty hilarious. The Trump straw targets key liberal weaknesses. They're strident humorlessness and misplaced priorities, and pokes them right in the eyes. The crusade to ban plastic straws is yet more proof of how liberals try to distract us from the harm they've done to our cities, our law enforcement, our job markets, and our border. Maybe no one will notice what they did to the humans of downtown L.A. and other Democratic hellholes if they save a turtle from a straw. Yep, an actual headline said, someday, a turtle may end up with a Trump-branded straw in its nose. Wow. Who knew reptiles did coke. So Trump saw this absurd crusade as a perfect opportunity for the new Republican Party, one that finally understands the power of fun and the muscle of mockery. Long the turf solely owned by the smirking left. The script's been flip. It's now the left the left who shriek like nosy neighbors and the right who are laughing out loud. The paper straw is a perfect symbol. A failed soggy replacement for something that work just fine. A paper straw is socialism to capitalism's sturdy plastic. How funny is it that the straw's purpose it to suck. So you think the left would do that well. Wrong. They even suck at sucking. I have to say that Trump might be the first president -- well, is the first president in history to galvanize trolling for fun and profit.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: So the campaign manager for Trump 2020, Brad Parscale tweeted last week that he's so over paper straws, hashtag liberal progress. This is exactly what they would do to you -- the economy as well, squeeze it until it doesn't work. And then they started selling real straws to raise tons of money, which -- this is the reaction, right? Like when you go so far to the left and you tell people they can't do something, they're going to continue doing it in the most troll worthy way possible and to make campaign donation to buy real straws. I would do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What other things, Juan, should they sell? Lawn darts?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I want everyone to listen because I'm going to give President Trump some credit. I think he is just genius of getting people to separate themselves from their money. So it's not fear we're going to take your guns, now we're going to take your straws, and you can mock the liberals -- oh, yeah, that's great. Mocking people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's fun.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's now -- it's not like, you know, it's silly and ridiculous. It's fun, so go right ahead. To me, you know, I just think the Bible says, you know, we should be good stewards of the earth. And now, oh, no, don't pay attention to that, just go ahead, do whatever you want.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What was the Bible printed on?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, paper --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Trees. Those poor trees, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg, I'm going to have to agree with Juan on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And here's why. I get that he's tap into this guy and say this is a brilliant marketing plan to raise a lot of money for the campaign --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's fine. I'm not like on a plastic straws jihad. But, we will eventually phase out plastic straws and here's why.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're the top -- in the top ten most polluted items on the world's beaches. And they clog up the streams and the waterways and the lakes and the rivers and the oceans because they're so thin they don't get collected up. So, when I'm on a beach I don't want to see a straw, I want to body surf without straws. I want to tan without straws. I know you do, too. When I fish because the fish eats the straws and then they die, I want to eat the fish before they die. I want to kill the fish, I don't want the straws to kill it. I think we can all agree on this that paper straws are better for the environment, and they don't disintegrate. I mean, how long do you take to sip an ice coffee, an hour? You sip it, it's over.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: This last like two seconds.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: They don't work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, they don't work.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Hold on a second.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: By the way, they try to give you metal straws --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- is what they chip your damn teeth.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It works fine.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: So unless Medicare in there --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- unless Medicare for all --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Unless Medicare for all is going to pay for my venire --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let me throw to the president talking about this, then, we'll get a response from you, OK? Let's do that.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I do think we have bigger problems in plastic straws. You know, it's interesting about plastic straws. So you have a little straw, but what about the plates, the wrappers and everything else that are much bigger and they're made of the same material? So, the straws are interesting. Everybody focuses on the straws. There's a lot of other things to focus, but it's an interesting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Dagen, the Washington Post wrote a piece, you know, saying like, you know, this is going to harm turtles. They're paper. The newspaper often comes in a plastic container. You know, it's hypocrisy all around.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: It is hypocrisy. I love the liberal lunacy and say San Francisco that bans plastic straws but the city is covered in human excrements, that's not just the stench of sanctimonious if you smell -- when you're walking around San Fran. And just one other thing, at the beaches you know what's a bigger problem than plastic straws? I don't know. Cigarette butts, candy wrappers, beer cans, condoms.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. So get rid of those --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're turning into a liberal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We can do it here, too.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: We're doing it here,

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And look, this straw is fully intact.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan and I are on the same side.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I agree with you because I'm going on vacation. I don't want all that junk on the beach.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So this is all selfish.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We can sell everything. He says what about the plastic --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love plastic. I love plastic.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I do, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Someday I'm going to have a lot of it in my face, so I love it even more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When you see liberal celebrities arguing against plastic as they shoot Botox into their face.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And other places.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I'm really worried about poisoning people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right, some Democrats now regret their takedown of former Senator Al Franken, we'll talk about that, next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Democrats are having serious regrets about forcing former Senator Al Franken of Minnesota out of office. Franken resigned back in 2017 over sexual misconduct allegations after widespread pressure from within his own party. But now, a New Yorker article reveals several Democratic senators wished he never stepped aside. And Franken said he, quote, absolutely regret, end quote, his decision, while adding -- and here I'm quoting again, the idea that anybody who accuses someone of something is always right, that's not the case. That isn't reality, end quote. Now, while some Democrats say they made a mistake, one of Franken's biggest critics, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand, is doubling down,

utterances.speaker: SEN. KIRSTEN GILLIBRAND, D-N.Y.
utterances.utterance: Senator Franken wasn't denying anything. It's his decision and his alone, whether to wait out his ethics committee hearing, whether to wait for his next election. The decision I made is whether or not to carry his water and stay silent. And to somehow blame me for a man's actions and a man decision is pretty absurd.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, do you think Franken should have resigned? He didn't have anything in the court of law, no due process, so I'm thinking, sometimes, you know, these cases can be subjective because time change, perspective changes, so I get people who said, yeah, he should get out saying now I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, he was pretty low on the Me-Too totem pole. I think everybody agrees with that. But this was in the context of the Democrats wanting to look pure while they're trying to attack Roy Moore. And it was fresh off the heels of the Weinstein situation, so they were going to get killed with what-about-ism if they have stuck behind Al Franken.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: At this table?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, just in the media -- in the media. But I think the real deal is the Jane Mayer who did this piece is not a real journalist. She's an advocate for Democrats. This was a puff piece to rehab his images and his career, and she didn't treat anybody the same way as she would have treated Al Franken. Why doesn't she look at some of the sexual harassment lawsuit settlements in Congress the taxpayers have to play for? No. She was a headache for the Bush administration, slimed CIA agents let Obama off the hook, and now she's back helping Trump -- helping people who hate Trump. This is what happens here with Democrats. They only care about due process for Democrats. Whenever there's an accusation against a Republican it's conviction. She says she pokes holes in the accuser's story? She -- what hole? The accuser said the photo with this was taken December 24th. She says oh, no, it was taken December 21st.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Whoa.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Whoa, big hole. I mean, I think they're much more holes poked in the Kavanaugh accuser's story than that. But ultimately, the Me-Too movement still strong. I think maybe it's swinging a little back and it's not as hysterical as it used to be. But men now, I think, are behaving better and women are reporting things immediately. But I still think -- bring back the slap rule. Once a man gets fresh, slap them right in the face. That will sting a lot.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. So -- but, Katie, you know, I'm thinking to myself about standards now. Jesse rightly mentioned that Jane Meyer had written a piece about the Kavanaugh hearings. And so I'm thinking to myself, what is the standard for elected officials with regards to inappropriate sexual behavior? Because it looks to me like, you know, when the charges are against the Democrat you don't get away, but when it's against Kavanaugh, yes, get away. Where's the due process?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, first of all, we should mention that the Kavanaugh case -- the senate judiciary committee came out with a 400-page report after all the committee hearings were over and he was confirmed showing that not a single accusation against him panned out and didn't have any kind of evidence. So you asked what the standard is, the standard is evidence, not jumping to conclusions, not necessarily believing women, but taking them seriously making sure you weigh both sides of the story.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But there's no such thing --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: -- especially as a writer who's claiming to be a journalist --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. But I'm saying to you that there's no such evidence presented in the Franken case.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: There were photos that were presented. There was, you know, information --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: She was asleep. She was asleep. And, oh, it's a joke.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: There's no information or evidence presented at all outside of accusations from 30 years ago. In fact, there's lot of evidence to show that they're connected, the accusers, to Democrats who was trying to take down Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh. So the standard is, everybody take a breath, if we want women to actually be taken seriously, you cannot continue to push forward false allegations or jump to conclusion because it actually hurts people who have real cases against men who are abusers or who are sexual predators.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So you think he should have resigned?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I don't -- I mean, I don't know what he should have done. He definitely didn't get the due process that he should have. And for Kirsten Gillibrand to sit there and say that, you know, I have nothing to deal with this, she was one of the first people to call --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: She was the first senator -

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: She was leading the charge on it. So she certainly had something to do with the pressure on him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, Dagen, Trump's been accused many times. He denies in every case. So all you have to do is deny and then the women aren't heard and, you know, is that all you want? Really, is that fair?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I think that the women have been heard in plenty of forums, quite frankly, Juan. And I will say this about Al Franken, what's the point of this article in the New Yorker for him? He's the victim. When you talked about that photo of Leanne Tweeden, she was asleep, and he got away with it, in part, and they're making excuses for it now because, oh, he's a comedian. There were seven other accusers which are mentioned in the article. And what is the point of this article in the New Yorker to send the message to Democrats and liberal men of like, next time, we'll go easy on you. But to the Republicans, they will bake fry and microwave you until there is nothing left.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think he's President still.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Say it again, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think President Trump is still there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. So, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I was thinking about this and I thought to myself well what sanctions are in place like you know you get someone like that guy Steve King with all of his white nationalist rhetoric, Republicans have sanctioned and stripped them. But they don't make him resign. The Democrats made Franken get out.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: They didn't make him do anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: His party ate him alive. It's the shoot first ask questions later world of the Me-Too movement. He was right there. However, he's not innocent. I mean I know personally two people he did this to. OK. We talked about it, not just Leeanne. We know that Kathie Lee - if Frank Gifford were alive today, he would beat the crap out of Al Franken. So, I think everybody knew this about Al Franken that he used to grab people, kiss but he bragged about it on Howard Stern or he talked about it in the green room, which was then brought up on Howard Stern. And there is visual evidence that Jane Mayer ignored. She used gossip to destroy Kavanaugh. But no, there is actually stories about Al Franken. I wish he had due process. I wish he stuck around. I wish he had actually been questioned. We could have seen with this go. But I think like a lot of people he had the progressive pig pass, which is like Bill Clinton, Harvey Weinstein, Epstein, they survive and thrive as long as you support Democrats. They look the other way.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, you're saying you thought he should have had due process before leaving.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. But I think that there was - he was guilty, but he should have gone through. He should have stuck around, but maybe he knew - maybe he knew it was going to get ugly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, you can't say that Greg isn't fair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Up next, shocking video shows New York City cops getting drenched with water and hit with buckets. Upsetting. Next on “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: The left's anti-cop rhetoric is being blamed for outrageous video showing New York City police officers being attacked. The cops were hit with objects and drenched with water and too wild scenes. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Oh! My God, they came over here to talk, they violated. They're not stopping.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is calling the incident completely unacceptable. But former Mayor Rudy Giuliani says, de Blasio is to blame for routinely disrespecting the police and former NYPD Commissioner Bernie Kerik is also blasting de Blasio.

utterances.speaker: BERNIE KERIK, FORMER NYPD COMMISSIONER
utterances.utterance: It makes me sick. Obstruction, disorderly conduct, harassment and a number of other charges but they won't be charged because you have a mayor in New York City that won't allow.

utterances.speaker: LAURA INGRAHAM, HOST
utterances.utterance: He's a disgrace.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Greg, so there has been plenty of rhetoric about how police should react. There's social media everywhere. They probably hesitated because they didn't want to be on video.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. We're seeing a moral crisis right now. Indecision makes police second guess because they know they will not get the support of upper management or the mayor. And that sets the tone for their behavior. It's a policy set by City Hall. If they do something, if they do the right thing which is to arrest and do this stuff, will the mayor just say no, it was just water. And I tell my son every day to watch out for you cops. Remember the New York Police Department is minority, majority. It's made up of minorities and they do the kind of work that keeps de Blasio in his job that allows him to run for President and run his mouth off. If they didn't do their jobs, he would be nowhere. This is a problem I feel. This is so upsetting to me because I know what's going on in the cop's minds.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They know that if they overreact or if they act and it's perceived as an overreaction, their lives are ruined, because it'll be on TV. However, they have to act. That's their job. So, I don't know. Should they be disciplined? What should you do? We have a lot of law enforcement that watch this show. I'd be interested in what you think. Should the police be disciplined or are they in a hopeless situation? This drives me crazy.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You mean disciplined for not acting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Disciplined for not acting or I mean you can't just tell people that what you did is wrong. People doing wrong things almost never listen.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yes. So, Jesse in 2016 there was a case of a Chicago police officer, a female and she was beat almost to death because she didn't want to react to the suspects who were beating her, because she feared backlash in the public sphere. And she almost lost her life over it. So, there are consequences just not with rhetoric but with policies that these cities are putting in place on the police.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's part of the Ferguson effect. Remember the Mike Brown Hands Up Don't Shoot tragedy, the Hands Up Don't Shoot was actually a myth. But there were massive amounts of riots and then police departments pulled back all over the country within the midst of paladins and you saw a spike in violent crime. They could have easily been charged with obstruction disorderly harassment, but because of the viral video now, everybody has a phone. It's like instant replay in sports. You make a decision and it's just going to get blasted all over the world in a loop and there is going to be less contest because bad camera angles and you're never going to win that argument and you're always going to be judged and you're always going to look bad. So, the mayor doesn't want a problem like that. And the police departments in the communities don't want a problem like that. So instead they hand back. But it's also this. There is less respect for authority figures in this country. I've seen parents get cursed out by their children in public. You've seen flight attendants be punched. We've seen ICE agents be disrespected. Teachers body slammed in schools, so it starts at home because parents aren't teaching young people how to respect their authority figures. Brownsville, Brooklyn where this happened. It's like one of the most dangerous streets in all of New York City. They had; I think it was 13 murders just in one precinct last year. So, it said these guys who are saving lives in the community are being humiliated like that. What if that gunshots went off; they'd be the first ones there to respond?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Juan, your reaction of the video.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I guess you can't assault a police officer. That's ridiculous. This makes it harder even when you have bad cops to have people come to your side and understand that cops sometimes abuse their authority. In this case, no one has said that these policemen were doing anything wrong. They're arresting someone and apparently with good reason otherwise, we would have heard about it by now. So, what you have is a bunch of juvenile jerks I think abusing these officers as human beings and I feel for the officers. I mean to me it's the police that demonstrated extraordinary restraint in this situation. And by the way I disagree with my colleagues here. I think the cops are to be saluted for demonstrating that kind of restraint because--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it sends a message, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hang on. Let me speak. I just think that when you have police who clearly act as adults when other people are acting like juvenile jerks, it sends a clear signal to all of us. The cops are right in this situation and we should back the cops. If they had overreacted which was the first word out of your mouth, overreacted. If they suddenly say oh this guy threw some water on me and now, I'm going to lock him up or I'm going to hit him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have to arrest him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You don't have to hit somebody, just put him in handcuffs.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I said I think that would have been for water on your head, that would have been too much. So, to me you know this is wholly different like those cops down in Louisiana that were fired today because they were threatening--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Case-by-case.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez is like, we have bad cops, but this was not it.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I want to Dagen in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No one even raised that they were bad cops. What we're saying is that if nothing is done that sends a message to the street that it can be repeated.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Law and order breaks down right away if you aren't going to hold them accountable.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: But Mayor de Blasio has put these officers in a position like you said that they can't react, that they know that he doesn't have their back. There has been a massive reduction in low level crime arrests in this city. And you know why, they're closing Rikers Island.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: They've got to reduce the prison population in the city by thousands of people. They don't - they know that they are not supported by the leadership here. Instead like when the lights go out here whereas de Blasio, he's in Iowa. It's the same thing. You need to arrest these - they need to go out and find out who these people are as they would in any reasonable place and arrest them.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We have real crime, but I must say I don't know why you guys go after de Blasio. We have the lowest crime rate in decades.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because we aren't going after the crimes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And de Blasio has more budget for the cops. But the cops Giuliani, the Republicans you know Claire, these guys just hate on de Blasio. I don't know why, but that's apparently--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: An incompetent lurch.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You might be the only person in New York who likes de Blasio. Anyway, you better think twice before posting a negative review online, it could land you in legal hot water. That outrageous story is up next.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You've all had an unpleasant experience or two at a business or restaurant. And maybe we left a scathing review or two or 10 later on Yelp but can posting something negative land you in legal jeopardy. A growing number of people across the country are actually being sued over their online reviews. With one case going as high as a million dollars and businesses are fighting back, they range from doctors' offices to theme parks and we'll take the other side of this because we've turned into a culture of complaint where everything is a hardship. Oh! My God, I went to this restaurant and they were closed on Labor Day, one star. I had a delicious meal, but the chef didn't come out and kiss my ring, one star. So, maybe people do need to get sued. We used to stand in the yard and yell at the neighbors' kids or like shout into the belly of our toilet.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
